column4: how easy is it to upgrade ubuntu, can it be done remotely without mess all my apps/settings up?
to hoary ?
the upgrade is easy....but do you really want it ? its in flux .... i.e. see the channel topic
i think you first need to unload the acpi module to get the apm one to work....
i'm not sure if: sudo rmmod acpi  could work, probably not because others depend on it
for a test, press escape on boot and then "e"  you can edit the kernel line ....
add the word: noacpi
space separated behind the word "splash"
then press b to boot.....
now load the apm module with the command thoreauputic gave you
hmm
k

try it.... the same way you added the noacpi option
nope...thats for testing.... and you have to reboot anyway to test it ;)
which link ?

look if the button module is loaded
your system supports acpi....use acpi
try: lsmod |grep button
so: sudo modprobe button
